subject: Photography
title: The Politics of Beauty Standards
description: One-minute skill: The Politics of Beauty Standards.

hook.text: Photoshop can shrink waists, smooth skin, and lighten complexions. Who decides what 'beautiful' looks like?

buildup.text: Fashion and beauty photography has long promoted narrow standards: thin, young, often Eurocentric ideals.

discovery.text: Digital retouching intensified this by making impossible perfection seem real â€” smooth skin, tiny pores, ideal bodies.

twist.text: Some countries now require disclosure labels on retouched images. The backlash against false beauty is growing.

climax.text: Photography both creates and can challenge beauty standards. The same tool that imposed limits can expand them.

punchline.text: The camera defines beauty. The question is: whose definition?

quiz.question: How are some countries responding to retouched beauty images?
options: Requiring disclosure labels on digitally altered photographs
